content: The Homeland Security Policy Act of 2005, also known as the Homeland Security Act of 2002, is amended to include a new title VI for the Under Secretary for Policy. The Homeland Security Policy Act of 2005 is amended to include a new title VI for the Under Secretary for Policy, who is appointed by the President with the advice and consent of the Senate. The Under Secretary for Policy serves as the principal policy advisor to the Secretary, provides direction for policy development, establishes a formal policymaking process, and evaluates programs to ensure they align with the Secretary's priorities. The Under Secretary for Policy is responsible for strategic planning, conducting net assessments, and ensuring the implementation of Department strategies. They also have international responsibilities, including promoting exchange of best practices and technologies related to homeland security with friendly nations.
